info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rutherford, western Lincoln, northern Cleveland and south central Burke Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northeast of Forest City, or 5 miles west of Casar, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Belwood, Lawndale, Fallston, Polkville, Waco, Casar, Kingstown, South Mountains State Park, Vale and Sunshine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
